rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Space about multiple dwellings with special reference to Montreal
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The thesis would start out by dealing with the multiple dwelling types, and their respective environments, as they occur in various countries. It would analyze, discuss and evaluate their merits. Brought into the study would be the planning aspects pertaining especially to the space about buildings and their atmosphere and appearance. Finally, certain theories and conclusions might be formulated to improve the environment about multiple dwellings locally.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Apartment houses -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.
Apartment houses.
Space (Architecture)
Communications and the Arts, Architecture.
Housing -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.
Housing.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Hydroxyethyl Derivatives of Glucose and of Cellulose.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: ( 1) The previously reported (22) 3-hydroxyethyl-1,2: 5,6-diisopropylidene-D-glucofuranose, of specifie rotation -32.5 degrees, was apparently contaminated with 1,2:5,6-diisopropylidene-D-glucofuranose. The correct specific rotation of the former compound was found to be -38.0 degrees. (2) A procedure was developed for preparing pure crystalline 3-hydroxyethylglucose on a larger scale. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Effects of Compression and the Role of the Hematoma in Fracture Healing.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: To test the hypothesis that compression hastens the healing of fractures, three groups of experimental fractures in dogs have been devised. The first group was treated by plate immobilization and compression. The control groups were immobilized with bone plates or intra medullary nails. 1). It was found that union occured more rapidly in the group treated with compression. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the Interactions of Plasma Proteins with Ketosteroids. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: It is well known that proteins interact to form complexes with a large and diverse group of substances. These interactions vary from the highly specific combination shown by the enzyme-substrate complex or the antibody-hapten reaction to the less specific binding which may be shown by blood proteins. The present work deals largely with complexes of the latter type, as manifested by the plasma proteins.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Stresses in Web and Stiffeners in an All-Welded Plate Girder.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: For this thesis, an all-welded plate girder, having a ratio of web depth to web thickness of 372, was used. Two panels of this girder had stiffener spacings to web depth of 1 to 1 and 1 to 2. The girder was subjected to loadings considerably in excess of theoretically calculated buckling loads for the two panels. Web stresses were measured at three sections of the girder and these were compared to theoretically calculated values. Bending stresses were measured at the extreme fibres of one section. The variations in stress along one pair of stiffeners was also recorded. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Civil Engineering.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some Effects of Perceptual Limitation in Human Subjects.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The aim of this work is to give a coherent account of experiments designed and carried out to try to illuminate our knowledge of the behavior of humans under conditions of isolation. The particular emphasis will be on susceptibility to changes in attitude produced by such conditions and on an attempt to discover something of the psychological variables involved. Finally, there will be an attempt to formulate some sort of explanatory principles which will give, or at least lead to, a predictive theory of such variations as may be observed in normal behavior.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on Cortical Localization in the Monkey "the Supplementary Motor Area."
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The following conclusions may be drawn from electrophysiological study of the efferent pathways of the supplementary and precentral motor areas: 1) Stimulation of the motor cortex by single, short duration square pulses evokes in the cord responses consisting of a stable "direct" early component of fixed latency and of an "indirect" late one, variable in amplitude form and latency. 2) Both components are electrically positive at the recording electrode tip against a diffuse reference. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Neurology and Neurosurgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Study of Group Work Methods and Techniques in Relation to Informal Education for Adults in Arts Crafts.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: In 1949 the Educational Department of the Montreal Young Women's Christian Association was merged with the arts and crafts interest groups of the Young Adult Department and the new Art Workshop and Educational Classes Department was assigned the challenging responsibility of developing an imaginative and creative program in the arts and crafts. The decision to initiate workshops in which young and enthusiastic amateurs could explore the world of design, rhythm and beauty and experience the thrill of creation put the Montreal Association into the ranks of those few Y.W.C.A.'s (1) who for some time have pioneered in the field of arts.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Absorption of Antibodies in Vitro by Monocytes (Large Mononuclear Leucocytes).
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Girard (54) found that rabbits in a state of induced monocytosis produced antisera of higher titre than normal rabbits. He also demonstrated that during active or passive immunization, the antibodies were concentrated in the monocytes. These findings suggest that monocytes may play a part in the production of antibodies or merely store them. Exudates rich in monocytes were obtained from rabbits in a state of artificially induced monocytosis. The monocytosis was induced by injections of MPA (Monocytosis producing agent) which was prepared from an extract of L. monocytogenes. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Attitudes Towards Fee Charging in a Family Agency.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The past decade has witnessed the introduction and development of fee charging in family agencies on this continent. This is a subject of current interest to lay and professional groups in various communities both in Canada and in the United States. Fee charging implies an understanding between client and agency that compensation for the service will be paid by the client. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Reactions of Nitrogen Atoms with the Butanes.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The reaction of nitrogen atoms with n-butane has been investigated at temperatures of 75 degrees C. and 250 degrees C., while the reaction with isobutene has been studied at temperatures of 100 degrees C. and 260 degrees C. Nitrogen atom flow was held constant while hydrocarbon flow rates were varied from 5 x 10-7 to 2 x 10-5 moles/sec. Hydrogen cyanide was the main product of both reactions. Smaller amounts of C2 hydrocarbons, mainly ethylene and acetylene, were produced in both reactions. Production of HCN, ethylene, and acetylene increased with increasing butane flow rates [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of the Life History of Trichobilharzia Cameroni Sp. Nov. (Family Schistosomatidae). [...]
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Six species of trematodes, of which five are regarded as new, have been investigated. All had cercarial stages in snails occurring in the Ottawa River. 1. Trichobilharzia cameroni sp. nov. is described. Its cercarial stage occurs in the snail Physa gyrina and is a cause of Swimmer's Itch locally. The adults and all stages in the life cycle are described in detail. Canaries, pigeons and domestic ducks were experimentally infected. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of Agency Services on Adoption and Relinquishment.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The study represents a survey of an agency's services to mothers in relation to adoption and the relinquishment of children. The time of a baby's placement for adoption is interwoven with the time required by a mother in making the decision to surrender her child. The study will attempt to discover the possibility of earlier adoption placement of children from available evidence of possible earlier declsions to relinquish children on the part of mothers, and from evidence of the babies' own readiness for adoption.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Seasonal Variations in Employment in Canada.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Industrial and trade activity can be varied by changes in the supply of raw materials, labour, capital, demand for the final products and through the hampering or aiding of the production process. Where these changes are ultimately due to climatic and conventional seasons the consequent variations are called "seasonal variations".
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies on the Pharmacology of Histamine Release.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: 1. A brief history of histamine research has been outlined and the release of histamine in metabolic activity, anaphylactic shock, anaphylactoid shock and trauma has been reviewed. Evidence for the participation of enzyme factors in all of these events has been presented. 2. The so called "histamine liberators" which are believed to release histamine without tissue injury have been reviewed in detail. The many similarities between anaphylactic reactions and the manifest actions of "histamine liberators" suggest that these two conditions produce their effects in the same way: ie. by the activation of an enzyme system. The term "anaphylacto-mlmetic" agent has been suggested as a better designation for compounds having the typical "histamine releasing" action.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: the Law of Aviation in Egypt: a Review of the Basic Concepts and Future Possibilities.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Comparative aviation law has evolved from the world wide development of aviation during the past three decades. Aviation, the youngest and speediest of the transportation media has gained the foremost position in the category of carriers. Its primary social and economic function as a carrier of persons and property has been achieved as a result of a rigid regulatory regime.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Measurement of Recirculation in Flame Stabilization.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An idealized combustion chamber is considered in which a fraction of the combustion products is returned through a separate passage to heat the incoming mixture. The four factors determining the behaviour of the flame are recirculation, reaction, upstream conduction, and losses to the walls. If conduction is neglected, the equation relating the remaining terms is soluble graphically to give a curve of temperature against time or distance. For given inlet conditions a critical degree of recirculation is specified, below which combustion will not be maintained.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Comparative Study of Two Remedial Methods of Group Training in Effective Reading.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Two experimental groups, composed principally of students at Sir George Williams College, were each given a course of training in remedial reading. The first course was given in 1950 and the second one was given in 1951. Different techniques were used in each year. The 1950 course may be described as mechanical and task-oriented. The 1951 course, on the other hand, had a clinical orientation. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Physico-Chemical Effects of Radio Frequency Fields.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: 1. An apparatus was built to follow the decomposition of benzene-diazo-acetate in solution by measuring the pressure of the nitrogen evolved in a constant volume system - the evolution of air from solution occurred simultaneously due to an initial decrease in pressure to protect the system. One of two otherwise similar cells was fitted with electrodes for application of an electric field. 2. The rate of pressure increase for a concentration of 0.4 g. per 1. was greatly accelerated by an electric field of 3000 volts per cm. and 1.5 megacycles. The effect of the field decreased rapidly as the concentration was increased, and at 1.6 g. per 1. the acceleration was barely discernible. The greatest effect was obtained for the gas evolution alone. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: a Study of the Physiology of Sporocytophaga Strains Isolated from Soils.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Sporocytophaga strains were isolated from soil and manure and the bacteria were purified by plating enriched cultures on glucose agar. The effects of nitrogen compounds, carbohydrates and growth factors, on the metabolism of the isolated strains were studied. Glucose, mannose and cellobiose were the only carbohydrates utilized by the cellulose decomposing Sporocytophaga strains. High concentrations 4.5 per cent, M/4 of glucose inhibited glucose but not endogenous respiration. The optimum glucose concentration for strain 5-80 was M/200. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Bacteriology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Construction of an Office Manual for a Social Planning Council.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Of interest from the viewpoint of research is the fact that this study was arranged as a piece of action research. This was achieved by encouraging participation of staff members of the Council to the end of better communication.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Stephanostomum histrix (Duj., 1845): Taxonomy, Morphology and Biology of the Adult and Metacercaria with Notes on Distribution.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: During the summer fishing season of 1949 packers in the Canadian Maritimes refused to purchase winter flounders (Pseudopleuronectes americanus) because small white cysts caused an unsightly appearance in the fillets. Later examination of the cysts confirmed that these cysts were the metacercarial stages of the marine trematode Stephanostomum histrix (Dujardin, 1845), first reported from the Bay of Fundy area by Stafford (1904).
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Parisitology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Determination of the Locus of Miniature Dominant, a New Alliele in Drosophila Melanogaster.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: 1. A study was carried out on the closely linked mutants miniature, dusky and miniature-dominant in Drosophila melanogaster. 2. The viability of miniature-dominant was measured for homozygous and heterozygous females and for hemizygous males. Evidence is presented that the death of such zygotes oceurs before hatching of the eggs. 3. Crossing over experiments showed a probable cross over between miniature and dusky but no crossing over between miniature-dominant and miniature or miniature-dominant and dusky. 4. Allelism was found to be shown between miniature-dominant and dusky, miniature-dominant and miniature, miniature-dominant and miniature259- 4, and miniature and miniature259- 4 5. The phenotypes of miniature dusky/+ + and miniature +/+dusky were found to differ and a position effect apparently occurs. 6. These mutants are compared to those at the lozenge, Star, and bithorax loci and the possibility that miniature and dusky represent repeated loci is considered.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Biology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: an Approach to Personality Through the Investigation of Perceptual Behaviour.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The past decade has witnessed a renewal of interest in the psychology of perception. This has been stimulated by the work of the students of personality and the social scene. Clinical psychologists have interested themselves in the contribution of personality to perception.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: theElectrode Behaviour of Mercury, Platinum and Copper.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The reactions that may occur at the surface of a metallic electrode immersed in an aqueous solution of a pure acid have been investigated by studies of overvoltage, zero potentials, and potential changes with and without current flow.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.
